text: Molly Bobak (born Molly Lamb; February 25, 1919 - March 2, 2014) was a Canadian teacher, writer, printmaker and painter. During World War II, she was the first Canadian woman artist into be sent to a battlefield to see Canada's war effort. Bobak was born Molly Lamb in Vancouver, British Columbia.Molly Bobak She studied at Vancouver School of Art. Bobak died in Fredericton, New Brunswick from natural causes, aged 95. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Canadian painters Category:People from Vancouver
title: Molly Bobak
